message.content:
cs.LG, cs.NA, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.SY

The paper deals with optimization algorithms in machine learning, specifically stochastic optimization. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the sub-category of Machine Learning (cs.LG). The paper also discusses the use of linear algebra methods, which suggests that it may also belong to the sub-category of Numerical Analysis (cs.NA). The use of probabilistic models and inference techniques suggests that the paper may also belong to the sub-category of Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also discusses the application of the proposed algorithm to computer vision problems, which suggests that it may belong to the sub-category of Computer Vision (cs.CV). Finally, the paper discusses the use of the proposed algorithm as an automatic learning-rate adaptation scheme, which suggests that it may also belong to the sub-category of Systems and Control (cs.SY).
